csv

Class CsvParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • csv.CsvParser

  • public class CsvParser
extends Object
    CSV file format parser class.

    This class is able to parse CSV files, following the format definition you give at construction.

    You'll need to close the internal file reader, using the close method after use.

    The default CSV file format is RFC

    See Also:
    CsvFormatSpecifier

      • CsvParser

        public CsvParser(String filepath,
         CsvFormatSpecifier format)
          throws FileNotFoundException
        Create a parser using the specified file path and CSV format. Opens a BufferedReader from to the file internally.
        Parameters:
        filepath - The path to the file to parse (relative or absolute)
        format - The CSV format we want to parse.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> parse(int numberOfLines)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          CsvParserException
        Parse n lines from the file. The file pointer will advance by the number n of lines passed as parameter each time this method is called. If you need to read the file from the beginning or from a specific line, see the reset method, or the advance method.

        Also, if the argument numberOfLines is greater than the remaining number of lines in the file, no exception will be thrown, and only the remaining lines will be read.

        Parameters:
        numberOfLines - Number of line to parse, and advance the file pointer by the number of line to read.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of parsed line, represented as ArrayLists of string also. Each ArrayLists can be thought as a row in a spreadsheet, and each element as a cell.
        Throws:
        IOException
        CsvParserException
        See Also:
        parse()

      • parse

        public ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> parse()
                                   throws IOException,
                                          CsvParserException
        Parse all lines from the file. After this call, the file pointer will be set to the end of the file.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of parsed line, represented as ArrayLists of string also. Each ArrayLists can be thought as a row in a spreadsheet, and each element as a cell.
        Throws:
        IOException
        CsvParserException
        See Also:
        parse(int numberOfLines)

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws IOException
        Reset the file stream pointer to the beginning of the file.

        The internal buffered will however be thrown away.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • advance

        public void advance(int n)
             throws IOException
        Advance the file stream pointer by n lines in the file.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of lines to advance.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the internal file stream.

        You need the call this method after use.

        Throws:
        IOException
